method.text: On a lightly floured board, roll out the pastry. Cut out circles (one per person), approximately 20 cm diameter.
Divide the salmon between the circles. In a bowl mix together the creme fraiche, dill and seasoning. Spoon over the salmon.

Brush around the edges with a little beaten egg. Carefully draw up two edges to meet at the top of the filling. Pinch together along the top to seal, using your thumb and finger to crimp the edges together.
Glaze the pastry with the remaining egg. Sprinkle with sesame seeds.
Place in the oven for 20 min or until the pastry is golden brown. Serve hot or delicious eaten cold.
